steps.title: Draw a large oblong at the middle of the page.
steps.content: Draw a large oblong at the middle of the page. Draw a vertical middle line which extends from both ends (left to right).

steps.title: Draw a smaller oval but with the same length as the middle line.
steps.content: Draw a smaller oval but with the same length as the middle line.

steps.title: Draw two rings facing each other using the curve lines as guide.
steps.content: Draw two rings facing each other using the curve lines as guide.

steps.title: Draw the adjoining edges and the laces that put them together.
steps.content: Draw the adjoining edges and the laces that put them together.

steps.title: Trace with a pen and erase unnecessary sketches.
steps.content: Trace with a pen and erase unnecessary sketches.

steps.title: Draw the football's shape (like a sideways egg) either with rounded or pointed ends.
steps.content: Draw the football's shape (like a sideways egg) either with rounded or pointed ends. The illustration here shows a rounded one, but footballs in real life tend to end in points.

steps.title: Draw two slightly curved lines near the middle.
steps.content: Draw two slightly curved lines near the middle. They should be mirror images of one another, as shown.

steps.title: Draw two rectangles near both edges.
steps.content: Draw two rectangles near both edges. Don't go beyond the lower line, though, or your football will look a bit unusual.

steps.title: Add in a long, thin rectangle in the upper line.
steps.content: Add in a long, thin rectangle in the upper line. Don't let it reach the two vertical rectangles!

steps.title: Add in eight small, rectangular shapes for the stitches.
steps.content: Add in eight small, rectangular shapes for the stitches. They can be as thick or thin as you like, but you probably don’t want to make them larger than the primary line if you’re going for a realistic look.

steps.title: Outline the picture and erase the guidelines.
steps.content: Outline the picture and erase the guidelines. Add more details if you want to, such as more lines to give it a weathered look, or even some players tossing it back and forth.

steps.title: Color it in.
steps.content: Color it in. Footballs mostly come in brown, but you might want to make yours the colors of your favorite team, or some sort of interesting pattern--that part is up to you!
